vision: To create a supplier portal platform that can be used by General contractors other independent contractors that would be used in the construction of commerical buildings. The portal will establish the rules and regulations to be part of the construction program. It would use a scorecarding system, and evaluation of supplier performance. It will be critical for the suppliers to not only commit for job work, but also any working materials and supplies needed to complete the job. From a construction plan, that can span many years, it would be important for current and future allocation of supplies and resources be tracked and accounted for. From this a live heterogenous warehouse management of inventory would be tracked and reported on. Based on supplier performance, future work can be given to more proven providers.
scope: Create a system that allows for not just tracking the suppliers but also their inventory of supplies needed. The supplier will need an onboarding process, collecting information, certifications, and other related documents and contractual terms. Once onboarded, they will be given visibility to scopes of work, they will have the details to bid on those scopes of work, labor, material type, quantity, and cost. Once they are selected, for the given scopes of work, they will be required to confirm scheduling and material inventory level, so if a work order requires 100 power outlets, the supplier will give details on their supply and planned fulfillment of the supply before beginning. The scope of work should go through planning, detailed estimation, review, and other supporting milestones required for construction, such as permitting and inspections. Create views for supplier status reviews, construction milestone reviews, costing, planning, and forecasting review for entire program. There should also be a risk management and change management processes to handle issues that come up during construction.

requirements.objective: Enhance transparency and accountability in handling ambiguous terms.
requirements.value: Enables stakeholders to monitor progress on ambiguous terms, reducing uncertainty and supporting SAFe's emphasis on transparency.
requirements.useCase: A stakeholder checks the status of a flagged term in a contract to determine if legal review is complete before finalizing compliance scoring.

requirements.text: The Scope of Work (SoW) document must include detailed specifications of deliverables, timelines, and acceptance criteria as mandatory attributes to ensure all supplier bids align with project expectations.
requirements.benefit: Reduces bid evaluation time by 20% through standardized submissions.
requirements.objective: Ensure consistency and clarity in supplier bids.
requirements.value: Minimizes miscommunication and rework, saving costs and time for the business.
requirements.useCase: Suppliers reference the SoW to prepare bids during the procurement phase.

requirements.text: Implement a validation checklist in the bid submission process to enforce 'no flexibility' by rejecting bids that deviate from the predefined SoW attributes.
requirements.benefit: Achieves 100% compliance with SoW requirements in submitted bids.
requirements.objective: Maintain strict adherence to project scope and standards.
requirements.value: Ensures fairness in supplier selection and reduces risk of scope creep for the project team.
requirements.useCase: System automatically flags non-compliant bids during supplier submission.

requirements.text: Develop a customizable dashboard view feature that allows user roles such as program managers and suppliers to select their preferred level of detail, including high-level summaries or detailed data, with configurable widgets for metrics and reports.
requirements.benefit: Increases user satisfaction by 20% through tailored data presentation as measured by user feedback surveys.
requirements.objective: Enhance user experience by providing role-specific data visibility.
requirements.value: Improves decision-making efficiency for program managers and suppliers by delivering relevant insights without information overload.
requirements.useCase: A program manager configures the dashboard to display high-level project status summaries, while a supplier opts for detailed inventory data.

requirements.text: Implement a role-based access control (RBAC) mechanism to ensure that dashboard customization options are restricted based on user roles, protecting sensitive data attributes like financial metrics from unauthorized access.
requirements.benefit: Reduces data exposure risk by 30% through controlled access as tracked by security audit logs.
requirements.objective: Ensure data security and compliance with organizational policies.
requirements.value: Builds trust with users by safeguarding sensitive information while maintaining usability for authorized access.
requirements.useCase: A supplier is restricted from viewing financial summaries visible only to program managers.

requirements.text: Implement a dynamic field categorization system in the supplier onboarding module to group mandatory fields by category (e.g., contact, certifications) with visual indicators such as asterisks or color coding for mandatory fields.
requirements.benefit: Reduces onboarding errors by 20% through clearer field identification.
requirements.objective: Enhance user clarity and reduce input errors during supplier onboarding.
requirements.value: Improves user experience and accelerates supplier onboarding process for faster project initiation.
requirements.useCase: A new supplier completes mandatory fields during onboarding for a construction project, ensuring all required data is captured efficiently.

requirements.text: Develop a configurable rules engine to prioritize and display mandatory fields based on project type (e.g., construction, IT services) by mapping project attributes to supplier field requirements.
requirements.benefit: Increases onboarding efficiency by 15% by tailoring fields to project needs.
requirements.objective: Ensure relevance of displayed fields to specific project contexts.
requirements.value: Minimizes irrelevant data entry, saving time for suppliers and project managers.
requirements.useCase: A project manager sets up a new IT services project, and only relevant supplier fields (e.g., software certifications) are displayed as mandatory.

requirements.text: Implement detailed tooltips for each compliance metric in the scorecard UI, ensuring the tooltip content includes definitions, data sources, and impact on overall compliance score as key attributes.
requirements.benefit: Reduces stakeholder misinterpretation of compliance data by at least 30% through user feedback surveys.
requirements.objective: Enhance clarity and transparency of compliance metrics for stakeholders.
requirements.value: Improves stakeholder trust and decision-making accuracy by providing contextual information directly within the UI.
requirements.useCase: Stakeholder reviews compliance scorecard during quarterly audit meeting and hovers over a metric to understand its significance.

requirements.text: Develop a dynamic update mechanism for tooltip content to reflect real-time changes in compliance metric definitions or data sources, linked to the backend compliance database entity.
requirements.benefit: Ensures 100% accuracy of tooltip information by syncing with the latest compliance data updates.
requirements.objective: Maintain up-to-date educational content within the UI for compliance metrics.
requirements.value: Prevents stakeholder confusion and maintains credibility of the compliance reporting system.
requirements.useCase: System automatically updates tooltip text when a compliance regulation changes in the backend database.

requirements.text: Develop a dedicated dashboard interface for displaying flagged ambiguous terms, including attributes such as term name, context, status, and date flagged, with filtering capabilities for status and priority.
requirements.benefit: Reduces review time by 30% for the legal team by providing a centralized and filterable view of flagged terms.
requirements.objective: Enhance clarity and efficiency in the legal review process.
requirements.value: Improves decision-making speed and accuracy for legal compliance.
requirements.useCase: Legal team reviews and resolves ambiguous terms during contract analysis.

requirements.text: Implement a status tracking mechanism for each flagged ambiguous term, with states such as 'Pending Review', 'Under Review', and 'Resolved', to reflect progress in the review workflow.
requirements.benefit: Increases transparency by providing real-time updates on term review progress, reducing miscommunication by 25%.
requirements.objective: Streamline workflow tracking using SAFe's focus on transparency and alignment.
requirements.value: Ensures all stakeholders are aligned on the status of critical legal terms.
requirements.useCase: Legal team updates term status after review completion.

requirements.text: Integrate a notification system to alert legal team members when new ambiguous terms are flagged or when status changes occur, including attributes like term ID and urgency level.
requirements.benefit: Decreases response time to newly flagged terms by 20% through timely alerts.
requirements.objective: Support SAFe's principle of fast feedback loops in critical workflows.
requirements.value: Ensures urgent legal issues are addressed promptly, reducing risk.
requirements.useCase: Legal team receives alerts for newly flagged terms requiring immediate attention.

requirements.text: Implement a prominent warning banner on the supplier bid submission portal interface to explicitly state the 'no flexibility' policy, ensuring visibility during the bid submission process with attributes such as color contrast, bold text, and placement at the top of the submission page.
requirements.benefit: Reduces bid rejection rate by at least 15% due to policy non-compliance within the first quarter of implementation.
requirements.objective: Enhance supplier awareness of critical submission policies to prevent errors.
requirements.value: Improves supplier experience by reducing rework and fosters trust in the platform's transparency.
requirements.useCase: Supplier submits a bid and immediately sees the 'no flexibility' policy warning before finalizing submission.

requirements.text: Add a mandatory acknowledgment checkbox linked to the 'no flexibility' policy warning banner in the supplier portal, requiring suppliers to confirm understanding before proceeding with bid submission.
requirements.benefit: Achieves 100% supplier acknowledgment of the policy for all submitted bids, trackable via system logs.
requirements.objective: Ensure active supplier engagement with policy terms during submission.
requirements.value: Minimizes legal or operational disputes by documenting supplier consent, protecting the business.
requirements.useCase: Supplier must check the acknowledgment box to enable the 'Submit Bid' button.

requirements.text: The Risk Management module must include a feature to track weather risks with real-time data integration from weather APIs, including attributes such as storm warnings, temperature extremes, and precipitation levels.
requirements.benefit: Reduces project delays by up to 20% through proactive weather risk mitigation.
requirements.objective: Enable timely decision-making to protect construction schedules and worker safety.
requirements.value: Minimizes costly downtime and ensures compliance with safety protocols for stakeholders.
requirements.useCase: Alert project managers of an incoming storm to reschedule outdoor tasks.

requirements.text: The Risk Management module must provide a regulatory compliance tracking entity with attributes like permit status, inspection schedules, and violation alerts, linked to automated notifications for deadlines.
requirements.benefit: Decreases regulatory fines by at least 15% through early identification of compliance issues.
requirements.objective: Ensure adherence to local and federal construction regulations.
requirements.value: Protects the business from legal penalties and reputational damage.
requirements.useCase: Notify project leads of an expiring permit to initiate renewal before deadline.

requirements.text: The Risk Management module must implement a financial risk assessment process to monitor budget overruns, with attributes including cost variance, funding delays, and cash flow projections, integrated with financial dashboards.
requirements.benefit: Improves budget adherence by identifying overruns within 5% of threshold limits.
requirements.objective: Support financial stability during construction projects.
requirements.value: Enables project stakeholders to make informed funding decisions and avoid cost escalations.
requirements.useCase: Flag a 10% budget overrun to trigger a review of resource allocation.

requirements.text: The system must implement a Predictive Allocation Engine to analyze multi-year construction plans, identify potential resource conflicts across projects, and suggest optimal allocation schedules based on resource availability, project priority, and timeline constraints. Entities: Resource, Project, Schedule; Attributes: Availability, Priority, Duration; Process: Conflict Prediction and Resolution.
requirements.benefit: Reduces resource conflicts by at least 30% through early detection and automated resolution.
requirements.objective: Ensure efficient resource utilization across multi-year projects.
requirements.value: Minimizes project delays and cost overruns for the business while improving planning accuracy for users.
requirements.useCase: A construction manager uploads a 5-year plan; the system flags overlapping resource demands for two projects in year 2 and suggests reallocation of equipment to avoid delays.

requirements.text: The system shall maintain a Resource Dependency Map to track interdependencies between resources, projects, and timelines, updating dynamically as plans change. Entities: Resource, Project, Timeline; Attributes: Dependency Type, Impact Level; Process: Dependency Mapping.
requirements.benefit: Improves conflict resolution accuracy by 25% through real-time dependency tracking.
requirements.objective: Provide visibility into resource interdependencies for better decision-making.
requirements.value: Enables proactive management of resource allocation, reducing risks for stakeholders.
requirements.useCase: A project manager adjusts a project timeline; the system updates the dependency map and alerts affected projects about potential resource shortages.

requirements.text: Implement a NoSQL database solution to store customizable supplier onboarding data with dynamic schemas supporting multiple project types, including entities like Supplier, Project, and OnboardingForm, and attributes such as CustomFields and ProjectType.
requirements.benefit: Reduces schema redesign efforts by 30% when new project types or fields are introduced.
requirements.objective: Enable flexible data storage for evolving supplier onboarding requirements.
requirements.value: Improves adaptability for business users by accommodating diverse supplier data without system downtime.
requirements.useCase: A new project type requiring unique onboarding fields is added, and the system stores the data without requiring database schema changes.

requirements.text: Design a retrieval process for supplier onboarding data that supports querying across customizable fields and project types, ensuring efficient access to entities like Supplier and Project with attributes like CustomFields and Status.
requirements.benefit: Decreases data retrieval time by 25% for cross-project supplier analysis.
requirements.objective: Ensure fast and accurate access to supplier data for reporting and decision-making.
requirements.value: Enhances user experience for project managers by providing quick insights into supplier onboarding progress.
requirements.useCase: A project manager queries onboarding status for suppliers across multiple project types to assess compliance.

requirements.text: Design a scalable relational database schema to store compliance data, including entities such as Suppliers, Compliance Records, and Audit Logs, with attributes like Supplier ID, Compliance Status, and Audit Timestamp.
requirements.benefit: Reduces data retrieval time by at least 30% through optimized schema design and indexing.
requirements.objective: Ensure efficient data storage and retrieval for compliance processing across multiple suppliers.
requirements.value: Enables the business to handle increasing supplier volumes without performance degradation, ensuring regulatory adherence.
requirements.useCase: Processing compliance data uploads from multiple suppliers daily to generate real-time compliance status reports.

requirements.text: Implement a data partitioning strategy in the relational database to separate compliance data by Supplier Region or Supplier Category as a key attribute.
requirements.benefit: Improves query performance by 25% for region-specific or category-specific compliance reports.
requirements.objective: Enhance scalability by logically isolating data subsets during processing.
requirements.value: Supports business expansion into new regions or categories without system overload, maintaining compliance reporting efficiency.
requirements.useCase: Generating monthly compliance reports filtered by supplier region for regulatory submission.

requirements.text: Develop a batch processing mechanism to handle large volumes of compliance data updates, focusing on the process of Data Validation and entities like Compliance Records with attributes such as Validation Status.
requirements.benefit: Processes at least 10,000 records per hour without system downtime.
requirements.objective: Prevent bottlenecks during peak data upload periods from multiple suppliers.
requirements.value: Ensures timely compliance updates, reducing the risk of penalties due to delayed processing.
requirements.useCase: Validating and updating compliance data during supplier data submission peaks.

requirements.text: The system must create a separate queue entity to store non-compliant bids that attempt to modify SoW details despite the 'no flexibility' rule, with attributes including bid ID, submission date, reason for non-compliance, and stakeholder approval status.
requirements.benefit: Reduces processing errors by isolating non-compliant bids, achieving a 20% reduction in manual review time.
requirements.objective: Ensure compliance with the 'no flexibility' rule while maintaining auditability of bid submissions.
requirements.value: Protects business integrity by enforcing contract terms and provides transparency for stakeholders.
requirements.process: Non-compliant bid segregation process: Upon submission, the system evaluates bids against SoW flexibility rules and routes non-compliant ones to a separate queue for review.
requirements.useCase: A vendor submits a bid with modified SoW details; the system flags it as non-compliant and moves it to the separate queue for stakeholder review.

requirements.text: The system must implement a notification process to alert stakeholders when a bid is placed in the non-compliant queue, including attributes such as bid ID, vendor name, and a link to the bid details.
requirements.benefit: Decreases stakeholder response time by 30% through automated alerts.
requirements.objective: Facilitate timely review and approval of non-compliant bids.
requirements.value: Improves operational efficiency and ensures stakeholders are promptly informed of exceptions.
requirements.process: Stakeholder notification process: Upon routing a bid to the non-compliant queue, the system triggers an automated email or in-app notification to relevant stakeholders.
requirements.useCase: A stakeholder receives an email alert within 5 minutes of a non-compliant bid being queued, enabling quick review and decision-making.
